skill.name: explore-codebase
skill.description: Pattern for efficiently exploring codebases using parallel subagents. Use when you need to understand code structure, find patterns, or gather context.
skill.summary: Pattern for efficiently exploring codebases using parallel subagents. Use when you need to understan...
skill.author: Clouder0

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill providing patterns for using Claude Code exploration tools. No executable code, network calls, or credential access. Static findings are false positives caused by the analyzer misinterpreting documentation syntax as code patterns.

content.value_statement: Understanding large codebases takes too long when done sequentially. This skill provides patterns for spawning parallel explorer subagents to gather context quickly and produce structured summaries.
actual_capabilities: Spawn parallel explorer subagents for broad searches
Use Glob to find files by pattern
Use Grep to search file contents
Read specific files for detailed inspection
Synthesize findings into structured YAML summaries
Identify architecture patterns and integration points
limitations: Only provides patterns, does not execute exploration itself
Depends on user to specify search scope and hints
Does not analyze binary or compiled files
Cannot access external APIs or network resources

use_cases.title: Understand project structure
use_cases.description: Map out architecture and identify patterns before making design decisions.

use_cases.title: Learn codebase conventions
use_cases.description: Quickly understand coding standards, directory structure, and existing implementations.

use_cases.title: Trace code flow
use_cases.description: Find related code paths and integration points to understand how features connect.

prompt_templates.title: Parallel exploration
prompt_templates.prompt: Spawn multiple explorers for different areas, then synthesize findings into YAML

output_examples.input: Explore the authentication system in this codebase
output: Uses JWT tokens stored in cookies

output_examples.input: Find all API endpoints and their handlers
Map the database schema and relationships
output: Users table with id, email, password_hash
Posts table links to users via user_id
Comments table links to both users and posts

best_practices: Start with broad exploration before diving deep into specific areas
Spawn multiple explorers in parallel to cover different areas simultaneously
Always produce structured YAML summaries to consolidate findings
anti_patterns: Sequential exploration when parallel would be faster
Vague search queries without hints or scope
Skipping the synthesis step and missing patterns

faq.question: What tools does this skill require?
faq.answer: Task, Read, Glob, and Grep tools are required. These are standard Claude Code tools.

faq.question: How many explorers can I spawn?
faq.answer: Spawn as many as needed to cover different areas. Parallel is faster than sequential.

faq.question: Is my code data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only reads files and produces summaries. No external data transmission.

faq.question: Can this skill modify my code?
faq.answer: No. The skill only uses read-only tools. It cannot write files or execute arbitrary code.

faq.question: How is this different from grep?
faq.answer: Grep finds patterns. This skill uses subagents to understand context and synthesize findings.

faq.question: What is the explorer subagent?
faq.answer: A custom dotagent agent with structured YAML output for exploration tasks.
